explanation.text: La₄H₂₃ with A15-type crystal structure has been experimentally confirmed to exist and exhibit superconductivity, validating the qualitative aspects of the claim.

However, experimental measurements show that A15-type La₄H₂₃ exhibits superconductivity with Tc = 90 K at P = 95 GPa, not the claimed Tc = 105 K at P = 60 GPa. The Tc discrepancy is 15 K (17% overestimate) and the pressure discrepancy is 35 GPa (58% underestimate).

The A15 phase of La₄H₂₃ is reported to be stable in the pressure range of 96-150 GPa, which does not include the claimed 60 GPa pressure. This raises questions about whether the A15 structure is even stable at the claimed pressure.

No experimental or computational evidence was found in the literature supporting the specific quantitative values stated in the claim (Tc = 105 K at 60 GPa). Multiple independent searches returned consistent results showing only the 90 K/95 GPa values.

The claim is partially infeasible because while the compound and superconducting phenomenon are real, the specific pressure-temperature conditions stated are not supported by experimental evidence. The claim would be feasible if adjusted to Tc ≈ 90 K at P ≈ 95 GPa.

ev1.citation: We present evidence for high-temperature superconductivity in binary La4H23 with A15-type structure featuring hydrogen cages at a pressure of P = 95 GPa. In resistance measurements, we observe superconductivity with a transition temperature Tc = 90 K.

ev2.citation: The A15-type structure has recently been detected in the lanthanum hydride binary system with single-crystal XRD by Laniel et al. at pressures between 96 GPa to 150 GPa. The discovery of high-temperature superconductivity in La4H23 with the A15 structure reinforces that hydrogen cage structures are beneficial for superconductivity.

ev3.citation: We present evidence for high-temperature superconductivity in binary La4 H23 at a pressure of P=95 G Pa, with A15-type arrangement of the lanthanum atoms in the type-I clathrate structure. In resistance measurements, we observe superconductivity with a transition temperature Tc∼90K.

ev4.citation: The A15-type structure has recently been detected in the lanthanum hydride binary system with single-crystal XRD by Laniel et al. at pressures between 96 GPa to 150 GPa.

ev5.citation: The second search returned the same sources, which reinforces the experimental findings but does not provide: 1. Any evidence for Tc = 105 K at any pressure 2. Any evidence for superconductivity at 60 GPa specifically 3. Any computational predictions showing different Tc values at different pressures
